householdChores.notes: Ensure no cat hair or food residue remains on dishes.
Rinse dishes to remove food and cat hair before loading.
Pay special attention to areas where cats shed the most. Use a vacuum with a HEPA filter.
Check for cat hair on clothes before washing. Use a lint roller on cat-haired items.
Clean the lint trap after every use to prevent cat hair buildup.
Vacuum under beds and in corners where cat hair accumulates.
Ensure to vacuum all hallways and common areas.
Clean up spilled food and cat hair immediately. Mop to remove paw prints.
Scoop waste and refresh litter. Dispose of waste properly to minimize odors.
Clean countertops, sinks, and mirrors. Remove cat hair from surfaces.
Thoroughly clean the toilet bowl and exterior.
Remove soap scum and cat hair from the shower/tub.
Dust all surfaces, including shelves, tables, and electronics. Remove cat hair from furniture.
Dust all surfaces, including shelves, tables, and electronics. Remove cat hair from furniture.
Dust all surfaces, including shelves, tables, and electronics. Remove cat hair from furniture.
Remove paw prints and cat nose prints.
Wipe down food and water bowls, and clean any spilled food or water.
